page.title: 04BLO'NORTON.
page.content: This is a small, quiet & scattered {FARMING}village (200-250), away from through traffic. New building is res- tricted by planning guidelines and has been limited to six in six years. The village has a church and hall, one public telephone and post box but little else as the shop/P.O. has recently closed. {SOIL}varies from silt to blue clay with mainly arable farming, and some grazing. There is a battery chicken farm, duck and pig farming and heifers reared for a Hinderclay dairy herd. A goat herd provides cheese and yoghurt. {HORSES}are stabled, and prepared for shows. A 1985 success was the award of 'The Horse Of The Year'. Prince Frederick Duleep Singh, 2nd son of the Maharaja of Lahore lived at the{HALL}for many years and is buried in the churchyard.
